title.narrative: 2.Service delivery: 2.1 Scale up 4 GBV Centers to become accredited GBV Centers of Excellence

description.narrative:
2.1 Scale up 4 GBV Centers to become accredited GBV Centers of Excellence
Pre-assessment of the Centers of Excellence : During the second year of the project IFH continued working with the National Council for Family Affairs and the Higher Population Council and I am Human and coordinated assessment visits for the targeted Centers of Excellence in, Zarqa, Karak, Ajloun and Sweileh and based on the assessment report, an implementation work plan was developed.
Assess building accessibility for people with disabilities and provide recommendations. An assessment tool was developed followed by field visits to the 4 centers in Sweileh, Karak, Ajloun and Zarqa .
An operational plan building on the recommendation raised in the Pre-assessment regarding the accessibility of the centers are being developed and continuous coordination meetings are conducted with I am Human Association. A report with recommendation was finalized and submitted to the technical committee at the relative centers. Since the GBV clinic in Karak was moved to another building and an additional assessment conducted for the new premises.
Development and implementation of capacity building and operation plans based on the results of the pre-assessment
A technical committee of 10 members from technical and managerial team sharing the experience and following the process for the center’s accreditation was established to monitor the implementation of the work plan and recommendations highlighted in the reassessment’s reports.
IFH technical team including the technical supervisors and GBV workers specialized in GBV and protection, have scientific and practical competencies and work directly with the cases updated IFH policies to comply with the accreditation requirements from NCFA including: • IFH strategic plan for the years from 2021-2023 including the KPIs for each pillar and program sector. (Annex 1 strategic plan of IFH). • IFH institutional service approach; showcasing the process of endorsement of the IFH strategy and the plans of actions plus the steps and procedures were documented. (Annex 2 shows the Institutional approach of IFH) • IFH institutional approach/GBV – this document shows the strategic level for the GBV program and how this program contributes into the fulfillment of IFH strategic objective, it also shows an overview about IFH scope of work as IFH is an internationally-recognized national and regional center providing prevention and rehabilitation services for survivors of domestic violence, sexual violence, and other kinds of gender-based violence. (Annex 3 shows that institutional approach of IFH in terms of GBV).
• IFH-MEAL policy in dealing with GBV cases: IFH developed a policy which indicates all the SOPs that must be taken into consideration while monitoring and evaluation; for example, in the monitoring part, the MEAL focal point used to monitor the indicators of each activity through: 1. Monitor the reports submitted by the assigned focal point in terms of number of beneficiaries and number of sessions provided. 2. Follow up on the activities held within the program, which include workshops and awareness campaigns, activities in terms of the number of workshops held, the number of attendees, and ensuring the correct documentation of the data taking into consideration the confidentiality and privacy. 3. Follow up on the capacity building program held within the gender-based violence program in terms of t number of trainings held, the number of attendees, the report submitted by the trainer. 4. Follow up the plans of the departments / centers with regard to the achievements of activities related to GBV programs and send a periodic report that includes feedback on the indicators’ achievement, the extent to which the desired goal has been achieved, the percentage of achievement. IFH case coordinator, case coordinator supervisors as well the multidisciplinary staff from medical, legal, and the physiotherapist were trained on the polices and how to implement them at the relative centers of excellence. Assessing PwD cases and referral to services  Assessment of 274 women with disabilities by a psychosocial, disability and legal experts, out of which 30 cases of violations against women were identified and documented on a case-by-case basis. All disabilities types (Hearing impairment, visual impairment, motor impairment, intellectual disability) are represented.  Referrals of 274 cases were made to lawyers, psychosocial experts, occupational therapy, speech therapist, physiotherapy and some cases were referred to business incubators. The process of referral is still undergoing. 40% of targeted women empowered.  177 women with disabilities received direct legal and psychosocial assistance by the socio legal centers. The remaining cases are to be followed during the second year of the project.  Post assessment the visits were conducted from the NCFA, HPC to the targeted centers. NCFA team conducted 6 visits to implement the post assessment evaluation for the centers of excellence from 18th of August until 8th of September 2021, and HPC conducted 8 evaluation visits in last September 2021 from 9th September to 16th September 2021, IFH team were interviewed and clarified the development in the working process after the national criteria for GBV and Youth followed, and they describe the improvement in the procedures. The interviews were conducted in a practical way by service providers in the centres, including case coordinators, supervisors and medical staff, taking into consideration the documentation process of cases and the application of national procedures in dealing with cases of gender-based violence and domestic violence. Reports were prepared for the post-evaluation of all centers with recommendations related to the development that took place in the center’s during the previous stage, in which the policies were practically applied. While also retaining this curriculum that will be applied for the coming years. “see the Annex NCFA, HPC post evaluation reports. Ongoing provision of services to the general public in the 4 clinics
During the second year of project implementation, there are case coordinators distributed in the centers of excellence (case coordinator in Karak , sweleh , Zarqa and Ajloun ) who provide case management and psychosocial support services to the survivors of GBV. The project covered 400 cases. Each case coordinator receives several cases 5 to 10 per month as new cases, they started to implement the case management steps, as well Hopkins pre assessment, and the pre satisfaction surveys is done. The case coordinator provided number of follow up session for each case, 4 session per month, but if the situation of cases requires more follow-up, this is also provided by the case coordinator to follow up the work plan and reached the final step of case management. For the next step in the project all the GBV cases who were provided the services in the center of excellence will apply the post assessment in Hopkins as well the satisfaction survey after these centers got officially accredited from the NCFA and HPC as well Im Human.

receiver-org.narrative: King Hussein Foundation;Their mission is to build upon King Hussein’s lifelong commitment to peace, sustainable community development and cross-cultural understanding through national and regional programs that promote education and leadership, economic empowerment and participatory decision-making.
